Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tomaskova
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa's for 7-days in April of 2012. We were in room 1512 which is right at the front of the Villa building, therefore it is steps away from transportation and the main lobby. We were also located close to the pool. It was clean, quiet, and all of our needs were met immediately. We absolutely loved having the full kitchen, and it saved us a ton of money instead of buying the dining plan. We look forward to going back to Disney, and staying at the Lodges again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Ironships
Reviews.Content: An amazing room. Stayed in a one bedroom villa for 4 nights. The attention to details just incredible. The villa had heaps of room for the family to spread out. Staff very helpful. A welcome relief after 4 weeks traveling with two kids. The smell of the trees on the veranda in the morning was just lovely. Never waited more than 10 mins for a bus or boat. Boat access to magic kingdom is worth it when returning after the fire works.

Reviews.Title: “My new home away from home”
Reviews.Author: LizGirl
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Villas at Disney's Wilderness Lodge. Upon entering the main lobby, I could not contain my "wow". The structure is so impressive in the way only Disney can do. The theming is fantastic. We had a one bedroom unit that had a nice kitchen and a wonderfully roomy bathroom area, including a large walk in closet. These units are very smartly laid out and make it easy to get comfortable. Since we were on the first floor, we had two walk out patios. The landscaping and decor are very relaxing. The proximity to Magic Kingdom can't be beat - you are right there but feel a world away from the hustle and bustle once you are back at the resort. The staff at the lodge was always very friendly and helpful. We even got to be the flag family and visit the roof of the main lodge. As for cleanliness, I was pretty happy. We left a small gratuity every day and mousekeeping took good care of us with extra toiletries and towel animals for the kids. They kept the room clean and even ran the dishwasher. We did have a couple of issues that were very minor - previous guests had put away the dishes when they were dirty, the shower door was a little rusty and likely needed to be replaced, and mousekeeping forgot to clean the toilet before we checked in. Overall, we were so pleased with the villas and can't wait to return! We booked a bounceback offer and will be back there very soon! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - great for families”
Reviews.Author: 1967foodie
Reviews.Content: My wife, 12yo daughter and I stayed four nights in the Villas at the Wilderness Lodge from April 10 – 14, 2012. We are DVC members and stayed on points. We stayed in a one bedroom room with a king bed and a sleeper sofa. Our room was on the 4th floor overlooking the front of the villas walk-way from the Wilderness Lodge. Our room was very clean when we arrived. The bedroom had a very comfortable mattress that was soft with good quality sheets and bedding. My wife liked the soft pillows. My daughter said the sleeper sofa was fine and she slept well each night. The bathroom had the toilet in a separate room with its own lockable door. The shower stall was huge with a nice Waterpick shower head. There was a separate area in the bathroom for the large jetted tub and vanity. This is also were the walk-in closet is located. The bathroom was accessed from both the master bedroom and the living area. The kitchen area was spotless when we arrived. The refrigerator was spotlessly clean as was the sink, stove, microwave and dishwasher. Disney does an excellent job in the way it “Themes” its resorts. The Wilderness Lodge is themed just like its name – as a lodge/log cabin. All areas show Disney’s attention to detail in how the theme is carried out throughout the report. All posts and beams are made to look like logs (if they are not actually wooden logs), and all metal handrails look like small logs. My only complaint about the room is how the bathroom is set up – there is no way to lock both doors that enter into the master bedroom from the living area and bathroom. There is a lock on the door from the living area to the MBR, but not on the door from the bathroom into the MBR. This door can be locked from the inside to prevent anyone from entering the bathroom, but not from entering the MBR. Small issue, but one I need to point out.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Escape”
Reviews.Author: luvs2hol
Reviews.Content: The minute you arrive at the hotel you really feel like you've been transported to the American Wilderness. The landscaping of the grounds is superb and we really enjoyed walking the nature trail, or even better, hire a surrey bike and save those tired legs. There always seemed to be a quiet corner of the grounds to sit and relax too. The villas building is impressive and the touches and attention to detail is the best that I've seen in Walt Disney World - you can really tell how much effort has gone in to the "imagineering" of the resort. The rooms were spotless and well thought out and the balcony, although compact, had a lovely relaxing view of the woods. We found the boat service to Magic Kingdom a great advantage and a novel way of getting to the park. The bus service was ok but it was annoying to detour to Fort Wilderness, often doubling back to continue on to the parks. We were glad to have our hire car - just be careful to remember where you park as the lot shared between the lodge and villas is massive. The staff were always helpful and friendly. The restaurant options were ok - we've eaten at both Whispering Canyon and Artist Point in the past and would definitely recommend the latter. Roaring Forks food court was also good - we used the drink refill station a lot and bought a few snacks from there too. The pool for the villas was quite small but we never found it that busy. The lodge pool was much bigger but in comparison, was always packed. We wish we had allotted more time to spent around the resort but we will be back to explore more in future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for families visting the Magic Kingdom.”
Reviews.Author: EdwardTylicki
Reviews.Content: This is my second time here and it is the perfect location for families visiting the Magic Kingdom. There are small boats that go from the property to the entrance to the Magic Kingdom. The rooms (two bedroom with a living room) are nice with views of the woods or lake. The place is great for families with young children. The pool and activities for kids are nice. Every night there is a water show of barges on the lake. I like the running trail along the lake and towards the Wilderness campground. I especially enjoy the laid back quiet feel of the villas after being in the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Transported away from the Everyday”
Reviews.Author: ecs44
Reviews.Content: Once you step into the gorgeous lobby, you are instantly transported away from your everyday life and are now in the midst of something Magical. Then you walk to the villas and find another intriguing lobby that sets your imagination free. The rooms are perfectly clean and offer some lovely views. Two pools - one with a slide & pool parties and one that is quiet but beautiful and relaxing. There's a beach with campfire, movie, & electrical water parade. Three restaurants and service via boat to Magic Kingdom. (There's also bus service to all other Disney attractions). A well appointed gift shop with souveniers as well as snacks. Plenty of things for kids to do and all in a lovely atmosphere. You could just hang out at the resort without even going to the parks and have a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Christmas season”
Reviews.Author: JAXTRAVELLINGMOM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December and loved everything about our visit. We stayed in the DVC 1 bedroom for 2 nights and the studio for 1 night. We prefer the 1 bedroom with a kitchen because we can cook our food and save money. The lobby in the hotel is decorated so beautifully and we were able to take a lot of great family photos. The restaraunts also have great food and atmosphere. The only con I can stay about the DVC area is that the units are very far removed from the main lobby hotel and it is a hike ith a 2 & 4 year old every day. There is a great little boat that docks at the hotel and will take you to the Magic Kingdom too.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Disney”
Reviews.Author: QTandToots
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Villas at Wilderness Lodge. I love the decor; if you like staying in a national park, this is perfect atmosphere. The staff was great and friendly. I had done online check in before arrival and after we went through the guard gate, we were actually greeted by someone who had our keys and welcome packet in hand. Pretty convenient! We drove most places but did use the Disney bus to get to Fort Wilderness for the Hoop de Doo show. It's the first stop so it was quick and easy. My only complaint is the lighting; things are pretty dim over the mirrors so a bit challenging to put make up on. I'd definitely stay there again though.

Reviews.Title: “one of favorites!”
Reviews.Author: john m
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time staying here, obviously one of our favorite Disney resorts. We had a great stay, the service was typical Disney quality..Awesome! The resort is in a great location, just a boat ride away from the Magic Kingdom. The themeing is excellent! The Whispering Canyon Cafe is a fun place to eat, the food is very good. It is themed so well, you wouldn't think you're in Florida. It feels just what it was themed for..like you're staying at a lodge in one of our national parks out west! Only drawback with this resort is the main pool. It just isn't on par with other Deluxe resort pools. A better water slide would definitly change my opinion. If the waterslide dosen't bother you then the pool is fine. I'd advise against accepting the handicaped room...unless you need it. We were given this room becuse it was the only one ready when we checked in, I was tired from driving , I just wanted to sleep, so I accepted it. You lose a lot of counter space, plus no eating counter and you need to put a towel in front of shower or your bathroom floor gets wet. These items will not prevent me from staying here again, this resort is a favorite! If it weren't for the handicap room I would've rated this excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Greg R
Reviews.Content: My wife, two daughters (ages 7 & 9), and I recently made our annual winter school vacation trip to Walt Disney World. Since we are Disney Vacation Club owners, we generally stay on property at DVC resorts. For this trip, we decided to stay at the Villas at Disney's Wilderness Lodge due to it's proximity to the Magic Kingdom. We were very happy with our choice! When we arrived at 11:30 AM our room was already ready. Normal check-in for Disney resorts is 3:00 PM, so we were extremely happy to be able to check-in early. We stayed in a studio room which comes equipped with a queen bed, double sleeper sofa, flat screen TV, dvd player, coffee maker, refrigerator, and microwave. We typically have a light breakfast in the room each morning, so the kitchen area made things easy. The resort has a great lobby and the grounds are beautifully maintained. Overall, you really get the feeling of being in the Northwest wilderness. In addition to the pools, the resort offers an arcade, a children's activity center, bike rentals, boat rentals, nightly marshmellow roasting and movies on the beach. We enjoyed a great dinner at the resort's signature restaurant, Artist Point, and the counter service restaurant, Roaring Forks, had lots of quick and tasty options as well. The location of the resort was terrific! The boat ride to the Magic Kingdom took less than 10 minutes. There is also a boat that will take you to the Contemporary Resort, which is convenient if you have reservations at the California Grill or Chef Mickey's. Buses are available to take you to the other parks and Downtown Disney. Overall, we were extremely happy with our decision to stay at the Villas at Disney's Wilderness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay... es un sueño el lugar”
Reviews.Author: Flor47
Reviews.Content: The room at villas is full-equipped with a microwave, a coffe maker, a toaster and a refrigerator. The hotel is near Magic Kingdom. From my room a saw a couple of deers and squirrels, beautiful and peaceful:). The room is comfortable. In the hotel there is a private beach, near the beach there is a place where you can rent boats and bikes. I RECOMMEND THIS AMAZING HOTEL! RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL! PACIFIC soo! AND VERY WELL EQUIPPED! We had a SUPER HOLIDAYS!

Reviews.Title: “Second time staying here was just as amazing as the first!!!”
Reviews.Author: sleepingbeauty_10
Reviews.Content: Love staying here! Rooms are spacious! Love the decor and vibe! Great home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Another winner for Disney!”
Reviews.Author: Belle_n_Daisy
Reviews.Content: We had a large group so we got a 2 bedroom and a studio. Both were decorated and maintained in the excellent Disney manner we've come to expect. The resort was nicely laid out and scenic. The restaurants were great, the store was great, the pools were great. We even caught an electric light parade on the water! This was our first visit to the Wilderness Villas and we would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Disney property!”
Reviews.Author: amieingeorgia
Reviews.Content: What can you say? This is Disney -- awesome customer service, amazing thematic decor right down to the geyser outside and the bubbling brook in the lobby. Nice rooms, comfortable beds; the rooms are a bit small compared to other Disney resorts, but you're only there to crash at night & get ready in the mornings anyway, right? The boat to MK is a nice touch, and there are pontoons you can rent and a light show at night on the water. There's a great general/gift store on site, and you really do feel like you're in a national park, or maybe even Jurassic Park (in a good way) at times. The negative? The rooms could use some refreshing like new carpet and for a place that caters to young kids, they really need to replace the stoves. The knobs are right there on the front of it -- eye level for our 18-month-old -- who just thought it was a great thing to turn those knobs. That is unsafe. But, if you're going to Disney, I highly recommend staying at a Disney resort so you get those extra benefits like Magic Hours in the parks & the meal plan, and if you're going to a Disney resort, the Wilderness Lodge is an excellent choice, and the villas have a full kitchen!

Reviews.Title: “Very woodsy and neat for Christmas!”
Reviews.Author: Lmcgraw551
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. this was the first time we got a one-bedroom at the Villas. This was a must and very nice for cooking breakfast (you can get all the fixings at the little store). Our view was great and the weather was beautiful. The lodge was neat for Christmas. Since we were at the Villas, Santa delievered the presents to the 2 story tree in the entry. Doesn't get much cooler than that. I do have to say that we ahve gotten spolied staying at the Beach club and having easy access to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. You can ride the boat to MAgic Kingdom but that is about it...everything else is by bus. We also did the carriage ride through the campgrounds--a must and worth every penny of the $60.00!!!

Reviews.Title: “First time at the Villas”
Reviews.Author: ChincoteagueWaves
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at one of the DVC club properties and we were impressed. We also for the first time "rented" points from a DVC member to do this. It saved us around $1500 off a regular room rate to do this. Check some of the disney boards or just search dvc club point rental and you will find it. Make sure you do your research and read everything before going forward. It' not for everyone, but it worked for us. We found a friendly and trustworthy DVC point owner with more points then he could use, so he made the reservation, booked our meal plan and I paid him a dollar amount per point. It worked and we will do it again. As to the property. Typical Disney in that it's done right, themed well, super clean and well maintained. Please note we look at a room a bit differently than many. For us, a trip to Disney isn't about the room...its a place to sleep, clean up and go back out for something else to do. On the whole, the room was adequate and comfortable, very clean as well. Our room had one queen and 1 sleep sofa. We are four, two adults, a 13 year old and a 9 year old. The only thing I can say not positive about the room is that it was the smallest of any room we have ever used at WDW. That's not to say it was too small, just wanted to be clear at times we felt we were walking all over each other. It functioned, but I could have used another 50 square feet or so. Balcony overlooked woods. Hidden Springs pool was a nice stop that was never very busy compared to the other pools. Our room was at the very end of a VERY long hall. When we turned the corner on the first day we laughed out loud at how long it was. Be prepared if you have folks in your party who don't get around so well, ask at the front desk when checking in, how close is the room to the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “More than amazing!”
Reviews.Author: 2BOYSMOM44
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with this property. I had asked friends for a recommendation and this property came up numerous times. So glad we stayed. The room was on the small side and we had thought we were getting 2 queeen beds when we got 1 queen and 1 pull out sofa bed. It was OK comfortable but the kids didn't complain...they were exhausted from the Magic Kingdom. I don't think I've stayed in a cleaner property. It was impeccable! We asked for more towels and they arrived promptly. Our luggage was waiting at our room on arrival with a bellman. Transportation to/ from Magic Kingdom (the only park we visited) was easy via boat or bus. We were there in November and the Christmas decorations were stunning. Everyone was pleasant and helpful. The room had a mini kitchen with refrigerator and microwave. We had a nice balcony overlooking the woods. The outdoor movie, lakeside, was fun as was seeing the geyser.

Reviews.Title: “So comfy! Just like home”
Reviews.Author: jentlewolf
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a two bedroom villa with a group of friends in November, 2011, for four nights. The Lodge is beautifully decorated. The beds were comfy, bathrooms large, and the kitchen was nice. We had no complaints at all about our stay. Grabbing the WDW transport was a short walk from our room. The pool by the villas was nice a quiet. The main pool by the hotel was a little louder from all the children playing. The poolside bar was nice and relaxing. Just everything you would expect from a Disney property. I would HIGHLY recommend the villas.

Reviews.Title: “Good time to visit WDW”
Reviews.Author: theaterguy
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Wilderness lodge and villas is a great way to get away from the large crowds and remain close to the action. Its the smallest of the vacation club properties. Has a great pool and outdoor pool bar. The staff at the pool bar are very friendly. It was october, so Kids are in school, except for those in strollers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: GMLee
Reviews.Content: In a fantastic location, just a short boat ride to the magic kingdom. Stayed in November, this is a wonderful resort. The rooms are small but are clean and have everything you could need for your stay. Loved it and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: livsmeem
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at the Wilderness Lodge and finally got my wish. We just returned from Disney and had such a good time. What a great resort! My husband and I had a one bedroom villa. He normally gets up earlier than me and I like the separate bedroom so he doesn't have to tip toe around me. It was so peaceful there. We loved the decor, pools were great, (we didn't have an opportunity to use them but they looked fabulous!), the beach is fun, the main restaurant is really good and they make it very fun for adults and kids. The quick service restaurant is ok - there are some really good sandwich selections. We didn't make it to the high-end restaurant; couldn't get reservations but we heard from many that it was quite good. In the villas, there is very little noise from other rooms, (we didn't hear any to be honest). There was no noise from the common hallway; there were a LOT of kids there so we were quite surprised we didn't hear them! There are nice walking/riding paths, boat rentals...you could spend days at this resort and never visit the parks and still have a good time. Beds and pillows were comfy - shower pressure good - kitchen more than adequate - well situated, (just a few minutes to the parks), excellent service, good food, fun events going on all the time... Yes, I would HIGHLY recommend this resort! I know some people feel like, 'why spend a little more on a room like this - you don't come to Disney to sit in your room', but you know, there is a lot of running around at those parks and a little down time is a very good thing. If you can spend that down time in a comfortable space, why not? We've stayed off the park before and frankly, most of the economy rooms are just a little icky. We've also stayed in other Disney resorts but this ranks as our favorite and we will absolutely go back to Wilderness Lodge when we visit Disney again.

Reviews.Title: “One of best DVC locations”
Reviews.Author: EveningStar7679
Reviews.Content: The Villas at Disney's Wilderness Lodge are one of the best Disney Vacation Club properties at Walt Disney World. First off, the atmosphere, it feels like you are at Yellowstone and there is not a Castle just a small boat ride away. The geyser that spouts every hour, hot springs, mountains building up the pool, and large trees makes it seem like you are at a resort tucked inside Yellowstone. The small touches like animal prints and leaf outlines in the concrete even add to. The atmosphere is enough to come back again and again. However, the rooms are excellent. They are spacious and carry through the theme. We stayed in a a studio which had a pull out bed and a queen bed. The pull out bed was as comfortable as the queen bed (which is rare to find!). When looking outside, the area was covered with trees and no sights of Florida...you were able to put yourself in the wilderness even more. The villas are separate from the actual hotel. There is a covered walkway, perfect for when those Florida afternoon storms come, to get there. The actual villa lobby branches off into a place to sit and visit, a play area and multiple art decoration areas. The elevators to take you to your room are fast. If you missed one, another elevator was going to be there in seconds. It was fabulous for when you were exhausted from a long day at the parks and was ready to be in your room and sleep. The quick service restaurant had a variety of offerings and specials. The sitting could get tight during peak times. It was always concerning when there was a long line to get food if you were going to be able to get a seat. But, the resort is spectacular. You could spend just a day there exploring and going in the pool. It was so much fun and I cannot wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Momofthreesweeties
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for eight days in November 2011 in one bedroom villa with my husband and three children. Had a great room, loved the peaceful setting, plenty of space for all of us. The resort is wonderful, one of my favorite here at Disney, great location to Magic Kingdom, able to ride boat or take bus easily. Only complaint is service at front desk, is really not good at all. Workers up front do not have great attitudes, definitely missing "the magic". Called several times to ask basic questions, which nobody knew. Disappointed in this aspect. Otherwise flawless experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, but not our "ambience"”
Reviews.Author: Jennjoonthego
Reviews.Content: We stayed here using our DVC points in October 2011 so we could enjoy the Epcot Food & Wine Festival. Check in was seamless and our room was ready early. The lobby is beautiful and filled with similar amenities to the other DVC Villas: a few restaurants, a bar, a gift shop, and arcade. Our room was very similar to the ones we stay at Saratoga Springs in layout, but in decor it had a very cabin like feel and color. It really was too dark for us. My husband made the comment that he would just go to a cabin in the woods if he wanted to stay in a cabin! Ha ha. We stayed in a one bedroom villa that has ample space for two adults and two relatively small kids aged 11 & 13. We will eventually reach a point where the kids will desire more privacy and/or room, but that's another story. Things that we disliked:the decor was too dark and made the room feel dated and the main pool layout seemed as though it was put in as an afterthought in the middle of a walkway. Plus the slide seemed geared toward kids younger than ours. Things we liked: the beach, the staff, the lake, the boat and bike rentals, the ease of transportation, the deer grazing right beside the walkway each evening. In conclusion, it's a great resort, but our family prefers light, open, more modern accommodations. We are used to Saratoga Springs which has an entirely different ambience. We will not stay at Wilderness Lodge again, but only because we prefer another Disney DVC villa.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: cal0899
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Wilderness Lodge Villas. They are like furnished condos with everything you'll need for your stay. The rooms are comfortable but a bit dark (maybe more lighting or better bulbs?) The thermostats weren't the best. The hall was constantly cool but our a/c didn't compare and couldn't keep up. The fold out couch was very comfy for our boys (one of the best mattresses I've encountered). The way the bathroom is separated into two rooms is smart for privacy. Nice to have 2 closets and 2 tvs. Deck/patio was nice but a little small. It was a lifesaver to have a washer/dryer after two days of heavy rain for our water-logged tennis shoes. The staff did a good job and were very polite. Be prepared for the high prices of the food in the gift shop. If we'd had a car I would have driven to a grocery store. The tap water has the sulfery smell/taste so bring/buy water if you can't tolerate it. Seems to me if the resorts on the Mayan Rivera can afford water treatment systems that Disney could as well?The ferry to Magic Kingdom was super-convenient and the boys loved watching the birds, otters, etc. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Coming back.....”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Wilderness Lodge since it first opened in 1996 I believe. We come in early December each year and have spent the last 4 visits in the villas. We highly recommend the main lodge and the villas but it is curious that you are not given a complimentary newspaper if you are in the villas but you are in the lodge. Doesn't quite make sense to me but then neither does the lack of wi-fi in the rooms. While annoying, neither of these factors are deal breakers because the experience is well worth it. All three dining locations on property are special in their own ways. What makes the Wilderness Lodge special is the staff. We are welcomed every year by a bellman we met in 1996 that remembers us by name and by various of the wait staff from the Whispering Canyon that also remember us. The last little negative comment I have is that the decorations around the Lodge at Christmas seem to be shrinking a bit every year. Having said that, we're still coming in 19 days!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort”
Reviews.Author: Heather G
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a week at the villas at wilderness lodge as part of our Disney vacation club membership in mid October .we did the on line check in which is great desk to room 5 mins. It is a beautiful laid resort with a serene feeling about it. We were a party of 2 adults and it is not always possible to get quiet adult time at Disney but this place hit all the buttons. The setting,quiet and family pools and fun restaurants. Excellent means of getting to the parks with boat and bus option making it easier to get to other resorts for dinner etc if you don't have a car I did the behind the scenes resort walk about which was great and very informative. Can't wait to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Quiet”
Reviews.Author: PartyofFiveNJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the second week of October. It is such a serene, quiet hotel. Beautiful to look at. The boat to the MK seemed to always be at the dock or just getting there. It was a great way to travel without all the chaos and hassle of the busses. One word on the bus transportation from here, every trip is either yoked with Fort Wilderness or Grand Floridian. Now, while they appear to be close to WL, they actually added on another 10 to 15 minutes to your ride to the park. So, every trip to any park ended up being at least 20 to 25 minutes, at the very best. Other than that, the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our home from home!”
Reviews.Author: McClures
Reviews.Content: Arrival in the lobby of this wonderful hotel and you are in awe of it. It is absolutely fantastic and truly characteristic of a wilderness lodge. Check-in for the villas was extremely efficient as we had used the online check-in facility so just had to pick up our pack and room key. The villas are in a separate lodge to the main hotel but you use all facilities. We were given "happy anniversary" badges as our wedding anniversary had been the day before we arrived, which was kind of special as every time we went past members of staff they wished us a happy anniversary! The lobby of the villas is just as detailed and amazing in its own right as the main lobby. We had a lovely spacious one-bedroomed villa overlooking the pool area, very beautiful, with all the facilities needed of a self-catering apartment. Having been in the Disney Vacation Club now since 1997, we have never been disappointed at the accommodation and are still extremely pleased that we ventured down the road of ownership. Will be returning to the Wilderness Lodge some time soon! And thank you to all the staff for their efficiency and pleasantness.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: PoisonedIvy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the villas at the lodge for 5 days during our honeymoon. It was fantastic. Truth to be told, we had a great deal with almost 40% off, so I don't know how much the villas normally cost. Positive - The room was cosy, spacious and even had a little terrace in the garden. - There's a seperate vanity area with 2 sinks. - The kitchenette was well equipped, with enough plastic plates etc. - The Villas are seperated from the main lodge and have a small swimming pool, so it's much more quiet than staying at the lodge. We especially loved the Pacific room. A great place to relax after a day in the parks. - You can go to the MK by boat, much nicer than taking the bus. - In summer, they make a campfire on the beach, to roast marshmellows. Negative The first day we got our refillable cup, but you can only fill it at the soda fountains in Roaring Forks. It would be great if there was a place also in the villa's. The bathroom was pretty small compared with the rest of the room. We had a great stay and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort...but improvement can be made”
Reviews.Author: thriftylil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the villas, in late September for a week to have space after a busy day at the park.......grounds were immaculate, villa,clean ,spacious and very comfortable. We were fortunate to have the lake view.The villas are exceptional becuase they feel like home..... Some concerns to share Check-in ...arrived at 11...checked in at 3...Reception was not magical. Restaurant.....very crowded at meal times Pool very crowded. Childrens activity area was un-shaded, and did not encourage children to stay long due to the sweltering 90 degree heat. Last but not least.....internet SHOULD be free with the cost of the room considered, although this complaint has been heard over and over again..Will save my $$$ to return, because the great outweighed the bad.....

Reviews.Title: “Best place ever!”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraJane
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Wilderness Lodge and can't wait to go back! You feel as if you are up North and for a native New Yorker, it just fits the bill. Loved the fireplaces that are all around the resort, it just made for a very cozy atmosphere. Our room was bright, clean, and I especially loved our little deck, which I loved sitting on in the evening. The main restaurant is truly family style, and lots of fun for kids. If you want a quiet meal, then this isn't where you want to eat. The food is good, but the place is more for children. They do have other places to eat on the property so don't worry about that. There is something there for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “You really feel like you're really in the wilderness...seriously!”
Reviews.Author: MacTavish
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom villa for 7 nights on the fourth floor. The villa was appointed very well and themed perfectly. The beds are very comfortable, and there is everything needed for a home away from home atmosphere. The grounds are absolutely georgous, and true to Disney, everything was impeccably maintained. The lounge area on the first floor has a two wonderful sitting areas with fireplaces. Any spot in this area will make you want to grab a good book, get comfortable, and relax! There are also perfect spots for this as well on the rocking chairs outside on the massive porch area. Take a walk down the "Nature Trail" if you get a chance. Its really neat. Knowing there are gators, wild turkeys (seriously!), etc. in the area, you'll never know what you'll run into...so you have to keep your eyes and ears in check! :-) The spanish moss definately adds to the beauty and authenticity of the overall experience. We also went to the Hoop-Dee-Doo Review. I highly recommend this. It was very funny and the food was very, very good considering this is a dinner show. The ribs and chicken were cooked perfectly - chicken was flavorful and juicy, and the ribs literally fell right off of the bone. Yum! I hope this was helpful and if you decide to go...HAVE FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Craig Z
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 10 day trip to WDW and stayed in the Wilderness Lodge villas for a couple of nights to end our vacation in style. We have 5 kids and the double room villa more than accommodated us. It is rustic in decor, yet luxurious with ammenities. Expense is the only drawback. I highly recommend renting a two person boat for 45 min and exploring the 2 lakes. There are a lot of poolside activities for the kids. The pool is a little crowded. The boat ride taxis to the MK are very convenient and fun. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families!!”
Reviews.Author: ligby
Reviews.Content: My husband (43), seven year old son and I (40) stayed here in June and had a great stay. We are Disney Vacation Club members and we were staying on points. We had a one bedroom villa on the first floor. When we checked in, I wasn't thrilled with the news that we had a first floor room but my fears were quickly doused when we arrived in our room. The view out the back windows was of pine trees and there were two small patios, one off the living room and one off the bedroom. It's really too hot to spend too much time sitting outside anyway, so it turned out to be fine. This hotel is big and having a room on the bottom floor made it a lot easier to get to our room after a long day at the park. The room had a "wilderness" camping theme. The colors were lots of dark greens, maroons and browns and woodsy looking. I loved the little hidden Mickeys in all of the carpets, curtains etc. There was a stackable washer and dryer, which is very useful. They supply you with one loads worth of soap, so if you plan to wash more, bring some from home. The kitchen was well stocked with everything you would need to prepare a real meal, fridge, regular stove/oven, microwave, dishwasher and untesils. The bathroom is a splt bathroom,with a toilet and sink and shower in one room area with a door and then the jacuzzi tube and sink in another half. The tub has a window that over looks the bedroom, but there are louvered shutters that you can close. There is a sofa bed in the living room that is really easy to set up and is quite comfy. The master bedroom had a King size bed, and extra overstuffed chair, dresser and a flat screen tv. There was also a flat screen tv in the living room. Overall, it was comfy and perfect for the three of us. The lodge itself is beautiful. There is a ferry that takes you to the magic kingdom and is really quick. There is an awesome "quiet"pool. There is also a pool with a slide, bar etc. The only downside I could say is that the parking lot and the rooms are really far apart. Not that this is a bad thing, unless it is 1:00am and everyones feet are tired. I would definatley stay here again. It was wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Brooklyntraveler_8
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 9 day stay at the Wilderness Lodge and did not want to leave. The hotel has a beautiful lobby that is modeled after the Old Faithful Inn in Yellowstone National Park. Maybe we loved the lodge because it reminded us of our wonderful trip to Yellowstone last year! The lobby is constructed of wood with beautiful craftmanship and has a stunning fireplace which is relaxing to sit by. The room was a bit small but was comfortable for my family of 4. Kids loved the bunk beds and we had a view of the villas,woods, and the villa pool. Do not get caught up in the view however since we were never in the room except to sleep or shower and did not even pay attention to the view! I know people have reported that the rooms seem a bit dark and dated. They are a bit dark,however if you ever stayed in a national park the rooms are a bit darker due to the wood furnishings,decor,and lighting. The hotel did NOT seem dated or worn at all! My one complaint would be that it did not have enough lighting. The pool was nice and the children loved the slide and the daily children's activities by the pool. The staff really kept them busy!! The kids also loved the movies on the beach at night but beware of getting bit by mosquitoes and bring bug spray to put on the kids beforehand. They also enjoyed nightly marshmallow roasts! We also enjoyed the boat ride to Magic Kingdom and Contemporary Resort which seemed to come every 10 minutes. I can't report on the buses because we rented a car. All staff that we met were very helpful and curteous and went out of their way to ensure we were having a great time. We did not like the Whispering Canyon Cafe as we felt it was loud and annoying although my husband did enjoy the skillet dinner. The Roaring Forks Cafe was convenient however we would have liked a more diverse menu to choose from as it seemed to have the same choices every day. The souvenier mugs were a great deal as you are able to refill them throughout your stay with coffee, water, and a variety of drinks. The kids loved refilling their mugs and felt it was a real treat. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I cannot compare to other Disney hotels except the Port Orleans French Quarter. The whole family agreed it was much better than Port Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place to Say at WDW”
Reviews.Author: bobemac
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to WDW and the WV. Last year we took our grandson, this year our granddaughter. The kids loved this place. We have stayed in a one bedroom villa, and there is plenty of room. We had a full kitchen that came supplied with all appliances and utensils. The toaster was not working, they replaced it with a new one immediately. Last year it was not as crowded. The small pool was overwhelmed this year. A negative was the constant testing of the fire alarm system all week. None of the operational controls for the properties are run by the property itself.There is a centralized control center which dispatches all support to the individual units. This can cause confusion and delays. The individual suites are amazingly quiet and private. Staying at the WDW Villas is like an oasis from the hustle and bustle of the theme parks. The decor and appointments are good and well suited to the NW USA during the intended era. The main lobby of the adjoining WL is simply breathtaking. The view from the roof is even more outstanding. The WDW cast members are very friendly and courteous. My axe to grind with WDW; there is no free Internet in any of their properties. You must pay $10/night unless you are a DVC owner. WDW also has stopped daily housekeeping support to all TS units exchanged from RCI. The transportation system at WDW is impressive. You never need a car. WDW will meet you at MCO with Disney's Magical Express, they also take your bags directly to your property seperately. We were able to get to the MK in ten minutes by boat. There are also boats and buses to everywhere on WDW. The grand kids were enthralled with the entire WDW experience. That's what it's all about anyway

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: ms957traveller
Reviews.Content: Not much can beat a three generation family vacation at WDW but staying at the Villas at the Wilderness Lodge was an additional bonus. It was nice to have the extra room and the Wilderness Lodge seems less congested and quieter than some of their mega resorts. Our only problem was lack of reliable Internet access. It's time for WDW to get with this century. Also it's wise to book your dinner reservations ASAP. Nothing's worse than having a hungry 3 year old at five pm and nothing available until 9 pm.

Reviews.Title: “stayed here 10 times and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: sueef
Reviews.Content: Athmosphere is awesome..relaxing the minute you arrive. Staff is great. Whispering canyon restaurant is a must with children..especially for breakfast. Artists pointe restaurant is great gourmet food for the adults.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge Villas still great”
Reviews.Author: palmharbormichelle
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before and went back again. We love this place for the ambiance, friendly employees, great pool, proximity to the Magic Kingdom, and more. The pool slide was open until 10pm which was great. If you stay here, take advantage of everything - movies at night on the beach, the electric water parade at 9:30 at the beach, the erupting geyser every hour, boat ride to Magic Kingdom, etc. Take a look around the lobby at the villas - there are two train cars from Walt's backyard train on display. We are DVC members and I don't know how many times I have stayed here, but this is the first time I saw the train cars. We are always so wrapped up in the parks; make sure and take a day off to really enjoy whatever Disney resort you stay at. Kitchen and bathroom were well stocked. The room was clean, but there was a big black ant crawling around in the bathroom when we got there. Flushed him and saw no more bugs after that. I live in Florida and understand the bug thing (NOT BED BUGS); the bug guy sprays my house regularly and we still have the occasional bug. And make sure you watch out for the bats - they fly right past your head at night on the walkway from the main lodge to the villas. This place is surrounded by woods and water, so remember that when choosing your resort.

Reviews.Title: “closeness to MK was stress free”
Reviews.Author: lobsterlovers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a one bedroom villa with my 2 kids through an RCI exchange and had the parents accross the hall in a studio. This was a great combination for privacy. I thought this was a great value of points compared to what it would have cost to pay cash. The villa was fantastic for us, made breakfast every day, inventive pull out couch where the cusions stay attached, easy to open, clean room. I missed having a view of something off the balcony. Could only see trees. It was so humid from first thing you couldn't sit out there. The staff was very switched on and helpful, no mistakes on billing, no lost dinner res;s, which I am used to from travelling mostly Carribean. A well oiled machine. Ran out of shampoo and called to ask if its supplied or do they sell it downstairs and they said it's not supplied but they sent up 2 weeks supply of everything. The main pool was packed and not much fun because of that. Bratty kids running loose. The villas pool was less packed but I had to keep telling my kids not to splash!! People were enjoying quiet relaxation. It would have been good if we could each go to different pools!! LOL I found the best feature of this resort the close walk to the boat shuttle from the villa (something other people complain about and I don't get it!) and the short, direct, ride over to MK which brings you right to the front gate. I think it took me just as long to walk to our rental car in the resort parking lot as it did to get to the boat dock. I rented a van and used it every day. A grocery trip, wallmart trip, other resort dining, and to other parks. Well worth it IMO. It took so little time to get to the other parks and resorts. good advantage to be able to drop the seniors off at the door then go park. Parking was easy everywhere and fast shuttles from parking. We took the boat to MK to Grand Floridian one night and it took an hour and a half.....boats also don't run if there's lightening!! Most dissapointing was the meal plan. I made a few in park dinner reservations and we had to get out of the parks around 3 cause it was 98'F. This left us with not what I would have liked for last minute dinner choices. Believe me, one night at the wispering canyon is enough. The second night I had an extremley overcooked steak and some chip and southwest dip app that tasted like dirt. I would have eaten more off property for some more fresher food options, probably half the price. They're not that far of a drive and I think would have been more enjoyable for all. Not to mention the 6 desserts left in our fridge on check out ....and thats with 2 kids!!! It would have been nice to have more dining options on site. I think my next choice would be the grand floridian as when we went there for dinner it is close to everything and offers more options...and no forest themes...I'm from Canada eh? no big deal, would rather have something more elegant. Yah what?? no free internet?? Hello?? What year is this???

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and perfect for Magic Kingdom trips!”
Reviews.Author: txwalkers
Reviews.Content: Very Family-friendly place, very clean, lots of things to do, plenty of options for dining. The snack bar/quick service place by the pool has burgers, fries, chips, desserts, beer, chicken nuggets, etc and a patio option. We loved using the boat to get to Magic Kingdom quickly!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: TrinidadW_i_Gillian
Reviews.Content: we had a two bd room villa from an rci points exchange. the villa was clean and well equip. the staff at the resort was extremely helpful. we had requested a room near an elevator but arrived late from the drive up from miami and was given a room that was a long walk from the elevator, almost to the end of the building however the costumer service rep relocated us the next day to a perfect room, we did however have to wait so we could not plan anything for that day but it was well worth it. shuttles to and from the parks were prompt and convenient. we had rented a car but did not use it much. the dining plan was good for a first time stay at a disney resort, but i would not use it again, too much food, and the room had a full kitchen. i would prefer to make reservations at the better restaurants and pay. the main pool was always crowded but the smaller one by the villas was private and less crowded. extra magic hours was the best. if ever i am doing disney parks again i would definitely stay at a disney resort for the magic hours. disney parks are too crowded with little kids as compared to the other parks. i could probably handle it once every three years. overall the resort was great except for the overcrowded pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PaxExplorer
Reviews.Content: I chose this location because of the convenience for participating in the 70.3 Ironman event at Fort Wilderness. I received a somewhat favorable rate being a repeat visitor to Disney. The Wilderness Villa’s are an extension of the Wilderness Lodge, essentially I found out they are part of Disney’s timeshare program but was able to rent one because of availability. We rented a Queen Studio room, which provided us a fridge (bigger than the standard micro-fridge), microwave, toaster, and coffeemaker. The room itself was non-descript basically about 2/3 the size of a standard Embassy Suite room. It had a sofa and TV and standard bathroom, nothing fancy. The one minor annoying aspect was the placement of the TV inside the console and could only be viewed from the bed and not the sofa. The grounds surrounding the lodge are very nice and cozy; there are two pools, one near the villa which is smaller and quieter then the main pool at the lodge which is only a short walk. There are hiking and biking areas to enjoy, there is a also a non-swimming beach area . One the main perks I enjoy staying on a Disney property is the extended park hours for guest and if you want access for free parking throughout Disney. There are busses that run from the grounds you just need to expect it will take about 45 minutes to arrive to your destination. This is assuming you need to wait the max time of 20 minutes btw busses. If you looking for a clean, quiet, comfortable room this is great but don’t expect any great features in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: brianz09
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights in a one bedroom villa, with a slight view of Bay Lake. Room was spacious and clean, and did not disappoint. Loved the pools and relatively quick trips to MK.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better...”
Reviews.Author: ILoveMickey654
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here over president's weekend and the first impression was not the best. We got to the room and it didn’t feel like Disney, it had a musty smell, but air freshener got it away. I found the room dirty and the sheets were stained, we called house keeping and they fixed it. They also didn’t give us pillows are the fold out couch, we called house keepingcame about 3 times the first day. When we went onto our balcony we saw bees and house keeping didn’t do anything! We were annoyed and tried to move to any other resort but they were all booked, but the great things were the pool, except that the geyser was closed ☹, and the walk from villas to the boat was long and annoying also. The pool was warm was nice and the mini café was convenient. Okay resort but will choose differently next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Villas at the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: John522
Reviews.Content: The Villas at the Wilderness Lodge are Great!! We rented a two bedroom and loved the amount of Space for the six of us; myself and wife, son and daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. It was so nice to have washer and dryer in the room. We didn't use the kitchen to cook, but it was nice to have the space and a large coffee maker. Trnasportaion to the Magic Kingdom was really excellent. The grandchildren loved the beach and swimming pools. Whispering Canyon Cafe is also great. Have the Skillet! We did online check in and it was quick and efficent. The only downside was the long walk to the room. The fitness center where my granddaughter had her first facial was also very good. The Staff was always warm, friendly, and helpful. The best part was that the Villas are very quiet and relaxing after a long day at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: allhandsondecker
Reviews.Content: stayed club level. had a view of MK fireworks everynight! The staff was wonderful and the hotel was amazing. Plan to stay there again next trip :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, cant wait to go again”
Reviews.Author: karensolihull
Reviews.Content: Have been coming to the villas for the last 12 years or so as a member of DVC. Never had any complaints whatsoever. Rooms are lovely, pool area lovely (although we use the villa pool rather than the main pool which gets a bit hectic) Location is perfect and is so easy to get out and about in Disney. The only very slight complaint is that they are letting the trees continue to grow higher and higher. This gives a lot of shade by the villa pool so would be a little chilly from time to time, we prefer the sun! Also the trees were right infront of some rooms which would make them a little dark. Overall this is a great place to stay and we're looking forward to going back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite of all Disney property!”
Reviews.Author: Coastie16
Reviews.Content: Spring Break!! My wife and I stayed here for the first time in a 1 bedroom - with no kids!!. We got the room location and view as requested - back side viewing Bay Lake and on a high floor. The room was clean, towel mouse on the bed and in the kitchen - the classic Disney touch! We had just purchased a new bed, so the Disney mattress was, to say the least, was a bit "uncomfortable" thus the "3" on sleep quality. We also took advantage of the refillable mugs for about $15/mug, well worth the cost on long stays; unlimited cold/hot drinks for your entire stay. We enjoyed the movie on the beach and the light show every night. Great relaxing atmosphere; ground floor area has very comfortable furniture for "just sitting" and/or playing checkers/cards. Wednesday through Saturday, Wonders of the Lodge tour is available at 9AM. The guide "cast member" explains everything in explicit detail how Disney theme is used throughout the resort - well worth the 1 hour. Guests checking in can also sign-up to assist the Ranger for raising the flags at 8AM. This is extremely popular and not a guarantee, if selected, the view from the top of the Lodge, we have been told, is fantastic. Please note, a "connecting" room is between a studio and a 1 bedroom with a lock-off.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Wilderness Lodge Villas”
Reviews.Author: MIDisneyPrincess
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day stay at the Wilderness Lodge Villas, April 4-7. The resort itself is very beautiful....we all know Disney doesn't miss a detail. The staff that I interacted with were very friendly and went out of their way to help. The villas is a separate building from the main lodge but an easy walk under a covered walkway. The resort is large so depending on where your room is, you can end up having a longer walk to the main lobby/pool area...just a note in case some of your family members have any health issues...make sure you request a room closer to the main area if that may be an issue. The Roaring Forks cafeteria is pretty basic really....a few salads, sandwiches and the basic hamburger, pizza etc. It doesn't have the choices that the moderates/values cafeterias do at all...in fact, I haven't found a deluxe/DVC resort that does. We never encountered any issues with the transportation ... both the buses and ferry were very prompt. Overall, we had a great time at the Wilderness Lodge and wouldn't hesitate to come back at all.

Reviews.Title: “Way over priced and terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Stacimaee
Reviews.Content: I am a florida resident and have had the luxury of staying Disney several times in my lifetime. I have a 5 year old boy and have stayed at the value, moderate and luxury resorts. By far this stay, the most expensive one, was the worst trip to Disney I have had. Its seems at Disney the more money you spend on a room the less amenities they have and the poorer customer service you get. Examples: only 2 pools one with slide. At the mod and value resorts there are pools at about every building. There are a wide range of food choices at the less expensive hotels. As far as customer service..we were actually told when asking for some napkins to go buy them in the gift shop or to go tho the womens bathroom and pull them from the dispenser. I wil never return to this hotel again! Big disappointment at a big expense!

Reviews.Title: “It's always been magical”
Reviews.Author: William1001
Reviews.Content: We have been DVC members since 2001, and this is our home resort. It fits us to a "T"! Families with small children might not fine it as enchanting, but for the 9 and up, crowd it's perfect. The first week of December is the best time to visit Walt Disney World!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Wildnerless Lodge Villas”
Reviews.Author: Katelewis97
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying on property and it was awesome. We rented a villa so we could have a kitchen/laundry and do meals in, pack cooler for the day at the park, etc. It went off without a hitch. We love the lodge and our villa was in close proximity to the bus depot (which I requested and they granted). I think my only negative about the property is that the kitchen and some of the furnishings seem outdated- even my 5 year old said something about it. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I Love this Place!”
Reviews.Author: CLR4321
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in the Wilderness Lodge Villas in the middle of our Disney vacation (stayed in a regular room at another Disney resort for the rest of the vacation). The lobby was beautiful with totem poles, a huge fireplace, and the beginning of a stream that led outside on to a river with a waterfall out in the pool area. It was spectacular! The villas had their own pool and jacuzzi aside from the main pool for the main part of the Wilderness Lodge. In the common area in the villas building, there were a few fireplaces with comfy chairs and tables with checkers and chess to play. We had a 1 bedroom villa that had a jacuzzi tub and sink in a separate part of the room inside the bedroom, plus a separate bathroom with a large shower. The kitchen was fully stocked and included a stove, dishwasher and fridge. Our toaster would not pop up by itself, and maintenance brought us a new one right away after we burnt some bagels by mistake. The washer and dryer was very convenient to have in the room. I will definitely consider this resort again if I am booking a villa. The proximity to the Magic Kingdom was awesome too!

Reviews.Title: “Grand children had a ball”
Reviews.Author: cherylg57
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa with 4 adults and 2 children in August. This trip was a birthday present to our 5 year old grand daughter. The weather was stifling and humid but the ceiling fans helped alot with the comfort factor. There was plenty of room in the villa for everyone. The bedrooms were spacious and comfortable with huge closets. The kitchenette had everything we needed for our 5 day stay. We ordered groceries from The Garden Grocer.com and they were delivered to our room upon arrival. The grandchildren espically enjoyed the carved animals in the lobby and had to say good morning to each and every one. I only have one complaint and that is with housekeeping. They came when the children were napping and said they would come back later and did not come back unitl the next day. I called the front desk and they sent up towels, but the trash and used towels was not collected until late the next day. It was a small detail to an otherwise great vacation. This villa has it all. The pool is smaller than the pool at the lodge, but you can use either. It is a long walk to the buses and dining areas, but it gave the kids a chance to run off some built up energy. Adults, not so much. The staff was helpful and friendly. They answered all our questions in a pleasant manner even though I am sure they answered the same question over and over every day. The employee in the gift shop was very friendly to the children. I am not sure I could be so cheerful after a long day. The boat ride to and from The Magic Kingdom at night is very calming with the night breeze coming off the lake. We highly recommend this villa!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoKman
Reviews.Content: The Villas are my family's favorite place to stay when we are at Disney. I am a DVC Member and this is my home resort. The room was in a great location with the cast members able complete all of our requests. The room was a two bedroom villa and was very clean and spacious. I only had a couple issues while on property, 1.) The Host at the Whispering Canyon Cafe was very rude. I was trying to get on the wait list for a party of ten. He said the wait would be at least an hour and a half, I said ok put me on the list. He then asked if my total party was in the lobby. I said no but they were almost back from the parks. I was then told I could not be placed on the list until all of my party was there. That is ridiculous that I can’t even get on the wait list when the wait is over an hour! 2.) Another issue was the DJ at Magic Kingdom on New Year's Eve. I herd the same song about 12 times with in a 2 hour span; I think its time for a new DJ 3.) Also what happened to the cast members saying " Have a Magical Day"? I didn’t hear that once when I was on my vacation. Over all the Villas at The Wilderness Lodge is a great place to stay, But I think that the Disney cast members are loosing their Magic.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort for Christmas!”
Reviews.Author: gemmybear83
Reviews.Content: We rented dvc points and stayed in a studio for 2 nights, we much preferred the studio room to the concierge room we stayed at Wilderness Lodge in 2009. We were in a disabled room so no bath and a big walk in shower, I guess we were put in this as we were only staying a couple of nights. If we had stayed longer we would have asked to be moved to a regular room as there was no safe in the room due to the change in layout. The positives was the studio was much bigger than a regular studio! The only downside of the studio was there was some litter left in the waste basket from the previous guests. Cast members were awesome, nicest ones we have come across and transportation to the parks were great, we loved the boat across to Magic Kingdom. The buses shared with the Grand Floridian and you were picked up/dropped off at WL first. Ate at roaring forks a couple of times and was great as always. Magical express was on time for the first time also! Would love to stay here again in the future - the resort always feels like we are coming home!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Wilderness Lodge Villas”
Reviews.Author: palmharbormichelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a villa studio for the last night of a 6 day trip to Orlando. Am a member of Disney Vacation Club and hadn't stayed here in 6 years. Still a great place. Son (11) swam in pool and enjoyed it. Loved the Electric Water Parade - if you stay here make sure you go to the beach around 9:30pm to view the great floats and hear the fun music. Room was clean. Fan in bathroom was very loud and squeeky. People next door let their kids scream from 7am to 11 pm. Otherwise all nice. Had lunch at Whispering Canyon - still a favorite place to go. Great food and good service. Resort nicely decorated for holidays. All resort employees provided great service as usual. Love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a holiday visit!”
Reviews.Author: RetiredNana08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villas Wilderness Lodge in a Studio for 4 ngts, 11/18 - 11/22. Although I'd been hesitant to stay here, my friend very much wanted to try the Resort and we were fortunate to find a studio available during a very busy time when the resort was sold out. The studio was larger than expected and in very good condition. It was a corner room with a balcony and side window (view of quiet pool), which made for a lot of natural light. VWL does not boast great views, but ours was quite nice: the lake through pine trees, but the trees were not dense, so we were able to see and hear the Electrical Water Pageant if we were in the room when it passed at 9:35 each night. We could also see the top of the Magic Kingdom fireworks (Wishes) from the the side window and balcony. We found the theme at the Villas to be much nicer and more understated than the Lodge - The Villa rooms and public areas are rustic, yet with a soft elegance. Rocking chairs inside and out - fireplaces and lovely areas to sit or gather. We had to contact a housekeeping manager for an issue unrelated to housekeeping/room cleanliness (one of us had a medical issue and we asked for a bit later check out time, which is nearly impossible to accommodate in the Villas) - she went out of her way to assist us. We found Cast Members at the front desk, shop and dining, to be excellent - warm, kind and very friendly. We would not hesitate to recommend the Villas (not the Lodge due to narrow hallways, rooms in need of refurbishment, noisy). Both the Villas and Lodge were decorated for the holidays by Friday morning (11/19) and truly beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “go Disney”
Reviews.Author: Dharmaloo
Reviews.Content: We used our RCI points to book here and I was a little worried. My worry was wasted! We were in a one bedroom suite with a full kitchen as promised. It was very well equiped. We ordered groceries before we left from Gardengrocer.com and that worked out great. It was delivered as promised and when they did, they sent me a text. The hotel stored the cold items in one of their coolers until we picked it up from them. If I were to do it again, I would have bought more food from them and took more snacks to the parks and had some items for dinner. We chose not to get the meal plan because we wanted the flexibility. We ate at the Roaring fork once - fun, the fine dining restaurant - OMG excellent! and the quick service got old very fast... I think because we were RCI they only came in once a did a quick clean - basically empty the garbages and change towels. The washer and dryer were nice to have. I brought extra soap from home. We were on the ground floor so we didn't have a view. It was quite except for one night the neighbors work us up. But... we would go so hard during the day we went to bed early. A couple times, we were work up by the electric parade on the lake - is that at 10pm - so take that with a grain of salt. We made a special effort to stay up for the fireworks and that was definately worth it. This is a great property to take advantage of the Disney transportation. I loved to take a boat whenever we could. The only thing I could complain about is the air conditioning - it definately works. We would run through the hallway to our room! We turned it off in our room and just used the ceiling fan.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax after a hectic day at the park”
Reviews.Author: mickey79
Reviews.Content: beautiful setting almost makes you think you left florida. Boat ride to Magic Kingdom was pleasant. Studio was great.

Reviews.Title: “Another incredible stay at the Villas!”
Reviews.Author: RustyGriswold
Reviews.Content: We had a room facing the woods/bay lake--very peaceful. The 2 bdrm villa is a great size, plenty of room for when you need downtime and you are not on top of each other. Used garden grocer to get grociers delivered so could utilize the full kitchen for breakfast. Quick boat ride to magic kingdom. The grounds and pool area a beautiful and truly feel like you are getting away from the hecticness of the parks when you return--we will be back, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “make sure you lock up your valuables.....they like to steal IPods from the room”
Reviews.Author: APPGirlOakRidge
Reviews.Content: A great day at the Magic Kingdon on 9/8/10 turned to crap when we returned to our Villas to find that an Ipod had been stolen. Front Desk staff wanted to claim that it had been "lost" and wiped thier hands clean of the incident. Now we are dealing with police reports and insurance claims. Takes away from what had been a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay at the Villas”
Reviews.Author: BronteReed
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week for our 10th Anniversary in a One Bedroom. As usual, the room was clean and well-kept. The staff, especially bell services, were wonderful and friendly. We were able to eat at the Roaring Forks several times and had good experiences always. The hand-tossed salad is especially good and addictive, lol. Their sandwiches are fresh and HUGE - you can easily share with a small child and save some money or save a meal credit. The store by the lobby is one of my favorite resort stores at Disney. They have a great selection of practical and classy clothing, a decent selection of grocery items, a few new bestseller books in case you want something to read by the pool, and a nice selection of toys and other items. If you're a DVC member, you can also pick up free dvd rentals here. And the lobby for the holidays is just AMAZING! It's one of the best at Disney - very romantic, cozy, and definitely makes you feel like you want to grab a chair by the big fireplace and just relax. It's a wonderful home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, "LARGE" place”
Reviews.Author: angi1968
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old son and I just returned from a 7 night stay at the Wilderness Villas. My son and I shared a studio room with a friend of mine and her 16 year old daughter. The room was spacious...my friend and her daughter slept in the queen-sized bed, I slept on the sofa bed, and my son slept on a twin-sized air mattress on the floor. There was plenty of room to walk around in the room even with the air mattress on the floor. The commode and tub were separate from the bathroom sink/vanity which made it nice in the mornings! There was a small kitchen sink and under-cabinet refrigerator in the room along with a coffee pot, microwave, and toaster. Since we were using the Disney Dining Plan we didn't need anything more from a kitchen. The room was quiet, and we were never bothered with any noise. Check out was awesome! We used the Disney airline check-in service which allowed us to check our luggage and print our boarding passes without leaving the resort! We were very thankful to already have those boarding passes when we arrived at the airport and saw the long lines for for Air Tran! Now for the "not so positive" things. 1) Our room (room 3562) was the last room in the longest hallway of the Villas! We were at least 1/4 of a mile away from the bus stops, so by the end of the day, that 1/4 of a mile felt like another 14 miles!!! If you have the quick service dining plan, you should also plan on walking a long way to the Roaring Fork restaurant because it's located on the back side of the Wilderness Lodge near the pool...this is farther away than the bus stops. There is a boat available to take you to/from the Magic Kingdom, but from our room, it was a good 1/2 mile walk. I am not exaggerating these distances....I felt like I was in Vegas! 2) You don't always get what you request. My friend has been a member of DVC since 2002 and commented that she had never had such a problem with her reservation. She made her reservation in November and we traveled in June so the reservation was made in plenty of time. When we arrived at the Villas, she was given a handicap accessible room which had a bathroom where the sink/vanity was in the same room as the shower and commode. This did not work for us since no one would be able to use the sink/vanity if someone else was in the shower. And, if you have small children, there is no tub in the handicap accessible rooms. She requested a room change and that is when we were given the room in BFE! On her reservation, she had requested a room near the laundry facilities which at the Wilderness Villas is near the front door on the first floor and she reminded them of this. She was informed that they would try to accommodate her, but they could only work with the Studio rooms that were coming available from people checking out on that date. So...as the story goes....your requests don't really mean a lot. 3) The laundry facilities are very lacking. There are 2 washers (one of which was broken the entire time we were there) and 4 dryers. Not much for a facility the size of the Wilderness Villas. I know that this doesn't mean much if you're staying in one of the larger rooms since they have washers and dryers, but it does if you're in the studio room. Who wants to spend 2 or 3 hours doing laundry with there one washer? 4) Our room did not have a view. I have read other reviews that commented on the view of the lake, but our room had a view of the service road. Overall, our stay was very good and I would go back to the Villas, but it wasn't all "magical" like some of the other comments.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hcorrell
Reviews.Content: My family (9 of us) stayed in a 2 bedroom villa at the Wilderness Lodge. We were so impressed with everything there. The staff was friendly and helpful and the room was beautiful. We could see the sunrise from our balcony each morning. There was so much room that the 5 children (under the age of 5) all had somwhere to sleep and all slept well. The best part of our ENTIRE Disney trip was the Whispering Canyon Cafe'. We celebrated my son's 5th birthday there and all the kids are still talking about how great it was. Mr. Rafael was our waiter, but really he was an entertainer that brought food. He made each one feel special and especially my son. All the kids think he is a rock star now. We had to go back each day the rest of our stay to say hi to him. The kids want to go back to see Mickey, but Mr. Rafael is 2nd that they want to see. I shoudl mention that the food was the best meal we had while visiting as well. The water launch was excellent to Magic Kingdom and we didn't wait long coming or going at any time. We LOVED the boat where we didn't have to collapse the stroller down to get across. My family and I had not been to Disney in 10 years and assumed we would come back in another 10. However, because our stay was so easy (Magical Express and help with luggage was AWESOME) we are thinking about coming every year and staying at this resort. Thanks Disney for helping my family make some really great memories!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and convenient (to the Magic Kingdom).”
Reviews.Author: TrpReviwr
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (mom, dad, 5-year old girl, 1-year old boy) stayed here for a week in late April. We stayed in the lodge last year and wanted more room, so we tried the villas this time. Getting to the Magic Kingdom (where we spent most of our stay) was so very convenient (short ferry ride). Despite this convenience, we felt that the villa side of Wilderness Lodge was very quiet, peaceful, and almost another world. We never heard any other families while in our villa. We felt like we had the place to ourselves. But the lodge and all of its conveniences was a very short walk away - even with 2 young children. We would get breakfast in the lodge at the counter service place and bring it up to our room many mornings. This was easy and convenient. We stayed in a 1-bedroom which worked out perfect for us. We had a little patio with a woods view near the villa pool. I was a little nervous about being so close to the pool, but we never found it to be noisy at all. We enjoyed sitting out there in the evenings and looking at the stars and trees. The beds were not particularly comfortable, but they were not terrible. Our villa was stocked with Palmolive dish soap, and Tide laundry detergent in addition to the usual supplies (pots, pans, plates). Housekeeping was very accomodating of our schedule without any special requests on our part. The villa pool was far less busy than the main pool at the lodge. The theming was very well done at this resort, and it made the place even more special. We would not hesitate to stay here again, although since we are curious, we may try another resort next time. My only complaint is that DIsney should really have free wi-fi at their hotels!

Reviews.Title: “I wish I never had to leave”
Reviews.Author: jnrcwdw1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times. Before the Wilderness Villas, it was always the Wilderness Lodge. I always enjoyed my stay there as well. Trying to tell of how wonderful it is is a difficult thing to do. It is a beautiful place. They have made it a place that you always will remember and will long to go back to. There is not a restaurant in this hotel/villa, but there are in the adjoining Wilderness Lodge. I highly recommend the Artist Point. I have eaten there every stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Property”
Reviews.Author: bobemac
Reviews.Content: We took our five year old grandson to WDW, and stayed at the Villas. You are so close to everything, just a boat ride to the Magic Kingdom. The one bedroom has plenty of room. There's a fully appointed kitchen, two flat screen TVs, and beautiful themed decor. Everything worked. The employees were all very friendly. Our grandson got to raise the flags onthe roof in the morning. He got a kick out of that. Great building, quiet and comfortable, with nice views of the secluded Villas pool and hot tub. Lots of flora and Fauna around. The only negatives was no maid service, and $10 a day for HS ISP.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: VivianS2
Reviews.Content: We went with freinds we got a dubble room. There were bunk beds in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Mickey knows how to do it...”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTruthful
Reviews.Content: Disney has the magic mastered, but there can still be imperfections. During our week stay the AC broke, the dishwasher had to be replaced, the pump on the whirlpool tub was replaced, and the light/exhaust in the master bath was broken. These villas are dated, but if you're interested in a wilderness experience, you'll get it here. I was disappointed that the only thing the front desk manager gave us for all of our maintenance inconvience was a fastpass that we didn't even need/use because we were there when the parks were not crowded. You can't beat the Disney bus service, the Extra Magic Hours you get by staying on property, and the total Disney immersion you feel when staying on-site. Is it worth the money? Debateable. Have I experienced nicer resorts in Orlando? Definitely! Would I stay here again? Certainly.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Wow, Wow - Pure Delight!”
Reviews.Author: MookiEriePA
Reviews.Content: We drove to Disney for a vacation 12/6-12/12/09. We were booked in Kidani Village but had lunch at Whispering Canyon on our first full day. Wow.
