We took the boat over from Magic Kingdom and it was fun and easy. Our jaws dropped when we walked in the place. It's beyond gorgeous. The lobby was towering with the biggest Christmas tree we had ever seen and thick, heavy garland and twinkling lights. Everyone seemed friendly and relaxed. Soft, traditional holiday music played in the background. That was it, it was love at first site. When my husband went to check in at the cafe, I visited the concierge and begged for a room transfer. Wow! talk about accomodating! They went well over and above to arrange it for the following day. We left Kidani early and checked in at the Wilderness Villas. The process was quick and painless. They took our cell number and texted us when our room was ready. We could not wait to see it. Wow! What a room! The Villas are a short walk from the main lobby under a covered walkway. Our room was around the center atrium. The decor was stunning. Garland and twinking lights the whole way. Short walks all around. Oh, and the scent... Have you ever been in the woods after a rain, surrounded by ferns and smelled that fresh, earthy smell? Yep, it smells that way on the walk to the Villas. The room was a one bedroom and HUGE. The kitchen was well stocked with real dishes and cutlery (Kidani had a few paper plates and plastic ware). The master bedroom was huge with an extraordinarily comfortable king bed. The kids loved the sofa bed. We all loved the huge jetted tub, separate shower, and plentiful storage. Everything worked as it should. Having a washer and dryer was wonderful. It was blessedly quiet and so convenient to everything. The busses worked very well and the boat was a delight. We loved the pools and hot tubs. The kids enjoyed the water slide and the bubbly water in the second pool. We didn't use the health club but it looked very clean and well equipped. We at at Whispering Canyon twice and that was fun. Roaring Forks was quite nice and the food tasty. Our favorite food was Artist Point - our waitress was fabulous and the food divine. We brought our 6 year old and 12 year old and they were warmly welcomed. To summarize, we adored the Villas at Wilderness Lodge. They were beautiful and so convenient. The staff was friendly and superb. The Lodge was very kid-friendly. I can't say enough positive things and we are huge fans. The Christmas decor was utterly breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “I want to live there!”
Reviews.Author: MattHMichigan
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best resort I have ever stayed at! I loved the theme, space, atmosphere and everything about it. I can honestly say there is nothing I didn't like. If you or anyone in your family like the outdoors and log cabins this is your place. Even if you don't like those things you should still stay just for the laid back atmosphere of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Halloween Treat!”
Reviews.Author: OhioTea
Reviews.Content: OUTSTANDING! My reaction was simple, jaw down, eyes up! There is so much detail, and things to see here that you don't even know where to begin! This hotel is a theme park unto itself! The rooms and bedding was 5 stars, as were the staff. Not one bad thing to say, everything was great! On the grounds, you can rent things like bicycles, do so and enjoy a ride around - we saw bunnies, and even a deer while riding around the grounds! There is a boatlaunch to the Magic Kingdom here, making this resort ideal if you want to do any of the special Holiday events at the Magic Kingdom! We attended the Disney Halloween party, and LOVED it! There are free mini events hosted at the hotel, such as a discussion about trains hosted by some of Disney's own trainer engineers!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay”
Reviews.Author: ropqsr
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 day stay with my husband, 4 year old, and in-laws. We stayed in a two bedroom villa which was perfect for us. Travel from the airport to the lodge was a breeze. We took the magical express from the airport. There was no wait and our bags arrived shortly after we did to the hotel. Return to the airport was even easier. We had a late 8PM flight on the day of check out and it was so nice to be able to check our bags for our flight that morning and get our boarding passes right in the hotel lobby. They held our carry-ons for us while we enjoyed our last day in the magic kingdom. Villa: The villa itself was very comfortable with a great layout for our family. Each bedroom was spacious and clean (one with king, second with two full beds) with large closets and baths. The kitchen/combined living room was well stocked. There was laundry detergent, paper towels, coffee maker etc... It was great after a long day at the parks to have the living area to relax. Our son loved it. Housekeeping came daily. The only drawback to the villa was that we were on the 5th floor and VERY far from the elevator. I'm a fit person but after walking in the parks all day then walking up and down that hallway all week , it got old fast. We ordered groceries ahead of time at gardengrocer.com. They were waiting for us when we checked in and were delivered to our room when we checked in. Wilderness Lodge in General: A wonderful place. We researched for a while and after stopping at many of the other hotels to compare during our stay we were so happy that we went with the Villas at Wilderness Lodge. The grounds were beautiful. My son loved seeing the rabbits, ducks, the geyser, the lobby is breathtaking. It was great to take the boat over to the magic kingdom or contemporay and hop on the monorail. The bus service to the other parks was also great. The pools were very nice. The main pool was very crowded at times. Liked the pool at the villas better ...smaller/quiet. Cubs Den: We also made a reservation one night for our son to have dinner on his own at the cubs den while my husband and I had a date. He absolutely loved it. The space itself is small but they have many toys, computers, sand pit for the kids and they eat dinner there as well. He was very content here and we had a wonderful time off on our own for a few hours. We found the price of $12/hour to be very reasonable. Dining: We were pleasantly surprised by the dining choices at Disney. We didn't go with very high expectations. Whispering Canyon in the lobby was an excellent choice for dinner our 1st night. Several of us got the all you can eat BBQ and it was great. We had a wonderful meal at the California Grill our last night. The fireworks were amazing with the most spectacular view. We also had a very nice lunch one day at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. The food in the parks was ok. Chef Mickey's for breakfast also just ok. Our son LOVED getting to see all of the characters here. So glad we got him an autograph book. In the parks you have to wait in line to see them but at Chef Mickey's all the characters come right up to the table. It was great; lots of good pics. The Roaring Fork at the Wilderness had great quick options. We tried to do a quick service at the Polynesian one day and left when nothing looked good to us. Territory lounge at night was also a great place in the lobby for a drink. Wished we could've bought beer at a reasonable price to keep in the fridge in the villa ($5 for one can) steep in the lobby shop. Wine was reasonably priced but limited selection. Gym: The gym was great and modern and on the 1st floor off the lobby in the villas building. All the cardio, wts etc. You could access it 24 hrs/d. My husband worked out just about everyday at 5AM. My husband and I enjoyed some wine in the lobby at the Grand Floridian one night while listening to a jazz band. Beautiful lobby. It seemed less geared towards children but really was pretty. Might be a better place for families with little girls. Lots of little girls dressed up taking pictures in the lobby while we were there. Loved the white lobby and they had a great selection of wine. Couldn't be any closer to the magic kingdom here either. We also loved seeing all of the animals at the Animal Kingdom Lodge while we enjoyed lunch. We debated booking here at first but after visiting I'm glad we didn't only because it really is so far away from everything else at Disney. All in all: wonderful stay! This was our sons 1st trip to Disney so we wanted to do it right and do everything we thought he would enjoy the most. I highly recommend the Villas at Wilderness Lodge. We had a wonderful family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay here again for the Holidays”
Reviews.Author: WeLoveDisney123
Reviews.Content: this review is a little late.. but better late than never! my husband and i are huge fans of the wilderness lodge and it's ambiance. we decided to stay in the villas in december because we read that the holiday decorations at the lodge are spectacular. they definitely are a site to see!! not only was the grounds and lobby of the main lodge beautifully decorated, but they carried the theme on nicely through to the villas. since we were staying 4 nights with our two young children (2 and 1) we decided to book a 1 bedroom villa for the space and kitchen. the carpets had just been replaced throughout the entire villas so they were all nice and clean.. it was great! the villa itself was clean and comfortably furnished. i was a little worried that they wouldn't come clean up everyday because i had heard that if it was a villa housekeeping only comes every few days.. this isn't the case if you booked the room without being a vacation club member. housekeeping still came to clean up the room every morning. we had a ground floor villa and the back patio was AMAZING! it was quiet and the kids sat on the grass and colored while hubby and i enjoyed a drink! we've stayed at the wilderness lodge 4 times and staying in the villas for the first time we could definitely see a difference. it's much quieter and relaxed. you can manage to find a seat next to the fireplace to enjoy a book. they also have a great room with chess and checkers which we imagined that we would enjoy once our kids are old enough. my husband and i definitely said staying at the wilderness lodge villas should be a yearly holiday tradition!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Home - Great Destination !”
Reviews.Author: familyof4wp
Reviews.Content: We are steady travelers to Disney World and love staying at the Villas at Wilderness Lodge. My 2 children and husband all look forward to walking in and hearing "Welcome Home" from the greeter. The 2 bedroom villas are spacious and clean. The restaraunts are all fun, especially the whispering canyon, the kids love all the action there. We love the location which is accessible to all the attractions via boat or bus.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and Spacious”
Reviews.Author: labeckley
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom suite at the Wilderness Lodge Villas as the second part of a split stay at the Port Orleans French Quarter. We were all excited to see how Disney deluxe accomodations would compare with those at a moderate. We were also looking forward to sleeping in larger beds (king with a queen sofa bed). And it was my husband's birthday, which I had let the reservationist know when she asked if we were celebrating anything. So I expected it to be fun at check-in, with my husband receiving and (undoubtedly be embarrassed) by a "happy birthday" and birthday button. Rocky Start However, though we loved the villas, our trip kind of got off on the wrong foot. I would not mention any of the following things but these villas, reserved through the Disney reservation system, are not inexpensive and my expectations were high. We had caught the boat from the French Quarter to downtown Disney, and had a wonderful lunch at Wolfgang Puck's. We decided we would have to return on our last day prior to departing for our late afternoon flight to get meals to bring on the plane. We caught the bus from downtown Disney to the Wilderness Lodge, and soon realized the long bus ride meant we would not have time to return to do a last-day stop at Wolfgang's.. The bus stopped at Typhoon Lagoon, and there was also an at least ten minute stop at Pleasure Island -- there isn't much left open at Pleasure Island, but it seemed to take some time to do a driver change. This was probably the longest bus ride we were on during our stay at Disney World. When we went to check-in at the Wilderness Lodge, there was no friendly greeting or mention of my husband's birthday or button (I know this may seem silly to mention, but I wanted him to get the full Disney treatment). We asked about our luggage transfer and the desk clerk checked and said it had not arrived and gave us a number to call to inquire further. My husband asked if she could check for us, and she did, only to find our luggage was not even en route -- it was still sitting at Port Orleans. So we went up to our room and immediately rushed to our balcony to take in the view. It was a view of the rooftop and the bus stop. My husband called Port Orleans and spoke to a supervisor at the Bell Desk, who arranged for our luggage to be taken over to us. My daughter had been excited about going to the pool, and we were all anxious to get out and see the property, but the swim suits were packed in our luggage that was being transferred and we had to just wait around in the room for a couple of hours for the luggage to arrive. I had suggested to my husband previously that we just catch a taxi and move our luggage ourselves, but everyone at Disney had been so exceptional prior to all this so he thought it would be okay. But next time we would move it in a taxi. I called the front desk to see if (1) they had any way of acknowledging birthdays and (2) if we could get a room with a better view. The lady at the front desk said they could send him a Mickey Mouse birthday card if I wanted, but he would not get it until the next day. I said that was fine. She then switched me over to another person about changing our room. This lady was extremely gracious and helpful and said that, while there were no rooms with better views available that day, she could move us the next morning so that is what we did. As it turned out, we did find the Mickey Mouse birthday card in our room when we returned from dinner at 1900 Park Fair that evening. It didn't have my husband's name on it, but it had arrived on his birthday. Our five year old immediately appropriated the card, saying that she thought Mickey had meant to leave it for her because she had met him the previous day and thought she must have made a good impression! We were very glad to receive the card. Wound up being a Great Place to Stay! Despite the intial disappointments, the one bedroom suite was really wonderful! As much as we loved the French Quarter, it felt so luxurious to be at the villas! The beds were large and comfortable, and there was a wonderful jacuzzi tub and shower and walk-in closet. There was a full kitchen where we could keep and reheat leftovers. The washer and dryer was SO convenient -- I was able to wash all of the dirty clothes we had accumulated in the first part of our stay. There were two television sets, a comfortable living room and a pleasant balcony amid the trees. We were really able to relax at this resort. I can certainly see why people would invest in these timeshares -- such a comfortable base when you're out doing the parks all day! The cleaning staff at this resort were absolutely excellent. Our rooms were extremely clean and well-kept. We asked for extra hangers and someone came immediately. They were really great! The grounds at the Wilderness Lodge are magnificent, among tall pine trees with a created waterfall, a white sand beach and playground, and a geyser that goes off in the background. We saw one very tame brown bunny that was allowing a little girl to get close enough to almost touch. There were two pools -- one smaller one by the villas and a larger one with waterslide in the main area. In the afternoons they host games at the pool. The boat service to and from the Magic Kingdom is delightful. We didn't wait long for boats, and the trip was not long. One evening, quite by accident, we found ourselves returning on the boat during Wishes, and it was fun to watch the fireworks from that vantage point. I was taken with how majestic the Wilderness Lodge looks at night. lanterns light the walkway from the boat dock among the Pines. The waterfall, pool and grounds look particularly spectacular amidst the night lighting. All in all, after a rocky start, we enjoyed a comfortable and relaxing stay at the Wilderness Lodge Villas and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Disney World Hotel We Have Ever Been To”
Reviews.Author: turnbull2357
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge from Auguest 22nd to the 29th. Overall we say its the best hotel weve been to. We stayed at the Villas but its the same thing but not staying in the main hotel itself. When we arrived at the front door a member opened the doors for my wife and daughter and took our bags off for us which was pretty fast and amazing. It was hot outside on the 22nd but once you got inside it was air conditioned and all the different tiki poles and how huge it is was pretty breath taking also. Check-in was faster than we could say "Disney World". We had a room in the Villas part on the 3rd floor around the hexagon I believe. The view was not great but the room its self was huge. We had our own kitchen so we cooked for 3 of the night we stayed which was money -saving and extremely conveinient.There was our own washer and dryer so we could wash our clothes and that means less luggage. My daughter had her toe bleed because of the metal thingy (forgot the name). The bed was big and comfortable. The bath was huge and so was the shower. We had a double sink which had not madness to fight for it. The walk to the pool was a short walk. Theres 2 different pools and both were great. But we used the Villas pool at about 8 o clock so the water was warm and we had it all to ourselves. It rained alot so we barely passed going to the hollywood studios because it was a raging storm. The walkway to the Wilderness Main Hotel was nice because you could see the flowers outside and a short walk to the Disney Buses was great. The indoor river was magnificent so we took alot of pictures. Theres 1 store for food or clothing and even games but I thought they shouldve had atleast 1 more store there. The Roaring Forks was good. We got the mugs so we dont have to pay like 15.00 for 4 sodas. (im just guessing). We went to Whispering Canyons one night and that was FUNNY. We had a waiter with funny glasses so my son loved that. He also needed Ketchup (for those who know what happens with that). So the waiter yells for ketchup and every single bottle of ketchup is brought to our table. 2 teenagers actually met there also while we were there. Short boat ride to the Magic Kingdom and buses to the other parks and downtown disney. We went to the House of Blues for breakfast and there was many food and drinks to choose from. I couldnt choose! Overall, this was one of the best hotels ive been to since Disney World opened in 1971. I reccommend this to every single person for vacation. :)

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved the Lincoln Log Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dagney1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Villas at Wilderness Lodge from 2/11/09 - 2/14/09. We had a two-bedroom suite. I shared the suite with my 3 children (7, 4, 1) and my parents. My husband could not come with due to work, but there would have been more than enough space for him as well. We had stayed in the Lodge about 3 years ago and loved the location and calmness of the Lodge. The Villa was nice - but one complaint was that it needed cleaned for the price of a $600+ night villa. It was fine per Comfort Inn standards - there were no outward dirt. But, we did find a teething ointment bottle folded up in the port-a-crib that came with the room. My father snores - and so my mom reported that the fold out sofa was comfortable. The villa was big enough that I didn't hear him, which is a good thing. The kitchen was clean, no spoons or bowls - which made breakfast interesting. Beware of the jets in the tub. I didn't notice that some were higher than others and ended up spraying my mother in the face with them when my daughter asked to see the bubbles. Again - not perfect, but funny. The kids loved the towels folded as animals. The location is great. We had a 8AM breakfast scheduled with Cinderella and we were told to catch the 7:30 boat. Unfortunately, the 7:30 boat was training new boaters - so we were left somewhat stranded. Panic is not allowed on vacation, so we loaded ourselves on the ferry to the Contemporary Hotel and then the monorail to the Kingdom. We made it with 5 minutes to spare. What started out as a bit stressful time ended up as one of my favorite memories. They let us into the Park before the masses - and then my 4 year old daughter - afraid to miss her meeting with Cinderella, hiked up her Belle dress and sprinted down Main Street full speed ahead. I had my video camera out and caught a bit of the action. I couldn't stop laughing at the sight of a little Princess running to her castle with all of the Disney music playing in the background. But as far as the Lodge was concerned, a bit of coordination and heads-up would have been nice when we asked about early transportation to the Park at the desk the day before. Would this happen at the Ritz? no. The Children's Activities were fun for my 7 and 4 year old. They gathered kids up and the pool and had games in the sand. The pool was busy and I did run into strict rules, which are a bit irritating. They have ducks in the pool - which is why I marked them down for cleanliness. My daughter wanted to swim with the ducks. So, I said gross, but okay and off she went. I sat near the edge of the pool with my diet Coke watching her. I was told that I couldn't have drinks in the pool. I wasn't in the pool, but said okay and put it behind my back. She told me that I had to have it 6 feet from the pool. Now, let me understand this - duck poop in the pool - okay - a diet coke 2 feet from the pool - not okay. It is just that you are paying lots of money and expect to be treated like you are home... not in kindergarten. The view was great - 4th floor with partial lake view. The room was big and everything worked. I don't like the Disney bus service and we didn't use it. But the boats were great and one afternoon they even passed out swards and the kids led by the co-pilot stood at the front of the ship and took over other Ferry boats pirate style. We would stay here again, but at the price that they are asking - they have some stiff competition.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort!”
Reviews.Author: 2CrazyKids
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Villas at Wilderness Lodge from 1/27/09 - 1/31/09. We had a one-bedroom suite, and my in-laws had a studio which connected to ours through double doors that could be locked on either side. To say we were impressed is an understatement. First, the resort itself is very beautiful - from the moment you walk into the well-decorated lobby at the main resort - you hear quiet, relaxing music and the sound of a bubbling creek; there are tall totem polls and comfy chairs. Go through the lobby and turn right through double doors, and you are on the covered path to the Villas. I found the Villas building to be quiet and more mellow than the main lodge. The rooms are beautifully decorated and ours was clean and not worn at all - reading some of the previous reviews, maybe we got lucky, but everything was in great shape. We traveled with our two boys, who are 4 and 1, and they both had a great experience. They adored the jacuzzi tub - it has never been easier to give them a bath! We asked for a crib rather than the standard pack-n-plays that come with the room, and it was delivered promptly. I was impressed with how large and comfortable it was. The mattress on our bed was soft for my taste, but basically okay. The outer room had a TV with a DVD player (nice when your kids want you up at 5:45 a.m. and you need a little time to relax and make coffee). There was a balcony with a woods view, and there were tall pine trees all around. A hawk landed right outside of our room on the last day; ducks swim in the main pool on a regular basis and we saw rabbits, too. The pools are fantastic. There is a very quiet, kidney-shaped pool in the Villas area, along with a spa. Towels and poolside seating are convenient. If you walk along the path toward the main building, you can see a beach by the lake (no swimming in the lake but you don't miss it since the pools are right there) - my youngest one loved digging in the sand, which is clean and soft. The pool by the main building is much larger and it is busier, but it wasn't crazy crowded when we went. There is also a nice shallow wading pool for younger kids, which both the boys enjoyed. One perk for parkgoers is the boat transportation to and from the Magic Kingdom. The buses are more conveniently located when you stay at the Villas, but if you care to take a walk to the other side of the resort, the boats can take you to Fort Wilderness or the Magic Kingdom. The ride itself is short (less than ten minutes) and so relaxing - you can see wading birds, as well as the other resorts. My boys loved the boat rides we took. Bus transportation elsewhere is doable. I found that the buses came pretty frequently, and there are comfortable places to sit while you wait. My husband and I cannot wait to go back to the Villas at Wilderness Lodge, especially when our boys are older and we can do a bit more. All in all, I highly recommend this place, especially for families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Resort was the Highlight!”
Reviews.Author: conkime
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Villas was a refreshing finish to each day. The parks were so crazy and busy during the holiday period that the serene, quiet ambiance helped to calm your nerves (cricket sounds were a nice touch). Throughout the day, it was not uncommon to see deer, rabbits and ducks wandering around the resort. We had a one room villa and our daughter (9) liked having her own space and T.V. Kitchens had all the amenties but it was difficult to buy any real groceries. The small mercantile store had a limited supply. The washer/dryer was great...next time, I'll take less clothes ...they provide detergent but not dryer sheets. Great transportation to Magic Kingdom (boat or bus). Other areas took quite a bit longer and really only available by bus. Pool area was nice and my daughter enjoyed the pool games in the afternoon. Limited sun at times which can be a bit chilly during the winter months. Whispering Canyon restaurant is fun (once)...but loud (that's what they are known for) and the Raging Fork snack shack was O.K. -- It is very easy to get around the resort and nothing is more than 2 minutes...I loved that! We really enjoyed the resort and would most definitely stay there again...the housekeeping made animals out of towels and washclothes and that was a really "cute touch" that my daughter is STILL talking about!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: acrum1
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed at the Villas twice and are returning for another visit in two weeks. We would not stay anywhere else. The accomidations are lovely and the environment is serene. This is a wonderful place for all ages. We can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Clean”
Reviews.Author: BlueH2O
Reviews.Content: This property definitely had the pacific northwest feeling! The grounds were always kept very clean and the people are all so caring. The winter holiday decor was pleasing to the eyes. (I loved the christmas tree). We were also able to get a complimentary wheelchair (first come, first serve basis) to use throughout our week long stay for Disney parks. We were on the fifth floor corner section. It was always quite there, I did not hear many noise levels in the hallways. The one bedroom was equipped with a full kitchen (stove, microwave, washer/dryer and sink with all the works such as detergent for clothes and dishes). The down side was that the washer and dryer & the bathroom toilet was extremely loud! You can seriously be awaken by the toilet being flushed (with the doors closed)! Also, my husband has allergies and he had a reactive symptom there because I think they need to change the air filters and some furniture needed dusting (I did it myself- which was no big deal). You can take the ferry boat to magic kingdom and the shuttles to the other parks. One thing I've learned was that you can't take the bus to get from one hotel to the other, except to get to the Grand Floridian on the hollywood studio bus. The Whispering Canyon restaurant in the hotel is okay and the roaring fork was decent for fast food. The lobby and restaurants are separate from the villas (it is about a 2 minute walk). Anyways, If you like that dark, woodsy outdoor feeling... then this is the place for you. I think we'll try a different Disney property next time. Overall, the Wilderness Lodge villas was a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST...”
Reviews.Author: tuliplor
Reviews.Content: The Villas at Wilderness Lodge are in a wonderful location. I like having the option of using the bus, boat or even going to the Contemporary Resort to get the monorail. We loved taking the Lodge tour with Stan the Ranger! What a gentleman! He made the experience fun and interesting. He gave us so many details that it made me like the resort even more. We had a 2 bedroom, Our family and friends stayed in a studio w/ a one bedroom. It had a full kitchen and a whirlpool tub. We loved being on the ground floor close to the bus stop. Perfect location! I liked the private pool and hot tub. We visited 3 or 4 times. The food at Whispering Canyon was great! It is a great experience for the family. Ask for the ketchup! We got to be the flag family!! HOW FUN!!! Ask when you check in. This is a beautiful resort!! We will visit again! We are vacation club members,

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Return To The Lodge”
Reviews.Author: kikiCharlotte
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled with our two girls (ages 4 and 2), as well as my parents, to the Wilderness Lodge in September. This was our first trip to WDW with kids and parents, so we wanted to make every effort to select somewhere very accessible. Since we knew working around nap time would be a must, accommodations close to the Magic Kingdom were the most important thing to us.. I am happy to say we could not be more pleased with the Wilderness Lodge. Regarding location, we found both the bus and ferry to be very prompt, with neither requiring more than a 15 minute wait. We had booked several character breakfasts at various resorts, in the early morning hours (7:30-8:00 am). Even at that hour, we found access from the Lodge to be prompt and without hassle. Regarding the Lodge itself, we opted to stay in a two bedroom villa in order to have the entire family together, and allow room for the kids and parents to rest without interruption. We were extremely impressed with our villa. The layout was excellent, everything was extremely clean, and both the furniture and beds were comfortable. If you enjoy a little quiet time after a busy day at the parks, you certainly find it at the villas. Not once did we experience noise from the corridor ,never waited on an elevator, and a pool designed to serve those staying at the Villas was a short walk away. I have noticed others writing on Trip Advisor had mixed reviews regarding customer service. However, we were very happy with our experience in this category as well. We arrived several hours prior to check in and found the front desk willing to go ahead and check us in. Our luggage actually beat us to our villa! We rented a car during our stay. Apparently the bellman noticed this when we arrived, as he brought a map with our luggage and highlighted the nearest grocery store, restaurants, etc.. The conceirge's desk was extremely helpful, making several reservations for us and never attempted to rush us into making a decision. Another great thing about the Lodge is all the entertainment available without leaving the resort. Between the two pools, bikes, boat rental, arcade, and walking trails, you can spend the day having fun without ever leaving, just in case you want to take a day off from the parks. We hope to visit Disney every 2 or 3 years if possible. Based on our experience this time, we will be staying at the Villas during our future trips.

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected”
Reviews.Author: mlstorey
Reviews.Content: I planned our trip to Disneyworld for two years, and the hardest thing was for me to pick our resort. Thankfully, the Villas were the answer to our prayers! We loved the lodge theme, and everytime we entered our lobby we really did feel like we were home. I felt like everything was pretty close, so meals, pools, and shopping were convenient. My family of 4 stayed for 8 days, so I knew we needed lots of room and I preferred a kitchen and washer and dryer. Our 1 bedroom villa was extremely roomy. We especially loved the bathroom (huge). Not being used to the humidity, we took lots of showers and washed lots of clothes. We found the whole property to be quiet and peaceful. Our only complaint was our bus wait times. It always seemed Wilderness Lodge was the last bus that showed up, but that really was our only complaint. Without a doubt we would choose exactly the same accomodations for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Willderness Lodge - Well Themed and Maintained”
Reviews.Author: MickeytheSorcerer
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (myself, wife and two teenage daughters stayed at the lodge for six nights in August. As members of DVC we try to sample different lodging each time we visit Disney World. We stayed in a one bedroom suite with a view of the quiet pool area. Check in went very well and the concierge area is very convienantly located next to check-in area. This made it one stop shopping as we purchased our theme park tickets, made reservations for dinner and picked up confirmation notices on previously made reservations. The property is not large and spread out like Saratoga Springs or Old Key West so it was easy walking distance to the bus or boat transportation and back to the main building. The lodge is well maintained, clean and the theming inside the main building and around the pool areas are pleasing to the eyes. The one area that we were a little displeased with was the bus transportation. I recommend the boat to MK it is more reliable even though it is only a 5 minute bus ride from the lodge. The problem that week seemed to be infrequent bus transportation more than 20 minutes apart and in our case almost a 45 minute wait for buses to Epcot or the Studios. Buses to these two resorts first stop at the Floridian so be prepared for crowded buses. All in all it was a pleasant experience, we rate this resort above both Saratoda Springs and Old Key West but a notch below the Boardwalk. We have not been to AK Lodge or the Beach Club so I can't comment if the Wilderness Lodge is a better stay. Its main advantage is it is close to the MK and the compact nature of the resort. Cast Members were helpful and I would revisit this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!! Quiet compared to the Lodge.”
Reviews.Author: oftheseas
Reviews.Content: We were already staying at the Wilderness Lodge when we decided to extend our stay because we were having such a great time in Disney World. The Lodge was booked, but they did have an opening at the Villas. We were happy because we didn't have to waste much time in getting over there. The Villas are very nice. We loved the decor and theming. If you stay, make sure you go and look around. They have a lot of nice quiet sitting areas. the beds are very comfortable. Everything was very clean and well kept. We thought the Villas are much quieter than the actual Lodge. We didn't hear any noise. We could only get a studio, so the room was a bit small for a family of 4. It was nice though to have a fridge and microwave in the room. The laundry room was very close and free of charge!!!(even though there is a slot for money, it doesn't accept money).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the villas!”
Reviews.Author: dfarner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villas during the week of the 4th of July. We had a one bedroom unit, which was plenty of room for us (2 adults and 2 kids). We arrived before 10:00 am and were lucky to get right into our room. The room was very clean and stocked up with all the "starter" packs you get with DVC-coffee, Tide, etc...The king size bed was wonderful, but the pull out sofa bed was dubbed "the Black Hole" by my 6 year old. Housekeeping was a mixed bag. We asked for bed rails and received those with no problem, but a couple nights later we asked for an extra blanket and it took 3 calls and a walk to the front desk before we could get one. We had a "trash and tidy" visit on our 4th day, and the beds were made, trash was taken out, and supplies were replenished. The villas are located off of the main lodge, but they are an easy walk from anywhere on the property. The property was extremely quiet and nice to come back to after being at the parks during one of their busiest weeks of the year. The grounds are gorgeous. There is a small sandy beach in the back with boat docks and a place to rent boats/bikes. We rented 2 Sea Racers one afternoon, and the price was very reasonable. They allow anyone over the age of 12 or 13 drive the boats, which I think is a bit young. We experienced a very hairy situation when a young boy was trying to maneuver his boat throught the canal at the same time one of the Disney ferries was going through. If you're going to let your pre-teen drive the boat, please go with him. The villas have a small, "geyser" pool, which was very nice. The main pool behind the lodge was very large, with plenty of pool chairs. Every afternoon they had a "pool party" with Limbo, Hula Hoop contests, dancing, and more. There is a bar and deli area right near the main pool area as well. There is some outside seating for eating, but the ducks and birds are VERY aggressive, and if being stalked by birds is not your thing I would not recommend eating outside. Transportation was never a problem. We waited probably not more than 10 minutes for a bus to any of the parks. We took the boat to MK one morning and it was quick and very peaceful. There is also a boat to the Contemporary, which we took one morning and then jumped on the monarail for a ride. I would definitely recommend the villas, especially if the Magic Kingdom is one of your main destinations while at Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Villas”
Reviews.Author: givemeoceans
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been members of the vacation club for almost 10 years, and this was the first time we stayed in the villas, as we had 2 extra guests. We had a two bedroom villa, and it was enormous. The room was spotless: the kitchen appliances were clean and functioning, the master bathroom was perfect. both bedrooms had small balconies that had partial views of the large quiet pool. the building was also very welcoming and fully encompassed the hotel's theme, as is expected with Disney resorts. The main pool area is wonderful, with a gentle waterfall safe enough for children. The pool bar is good, but the pool bars at the Coronado Springs and the Boardwalk were better. The snack bar near the pool provided a wealth of snacks for everyone throughout the day, and our group would get breakfast there if we weren't going to a theme breakfast that day. The staff was friendly, though we bumped into a few staff members that weren't exactly feeling the "Disney magic". We didn't let that get to us. Mostly everything we needed was taken care of immediately. There are two restaurants in the hotel, and we only ate at the theme restaurant (its a barbeque restaurant). Be prepared for very involved waitstaff - if you don't like LOUD, crazy, get you up out of your seat to do a rodeo dance around the room kind of dining, then i suggest you don't go here. it's a great atmosphere for kids, but only go there if you are open to semi-obnoxiousness and you have a sense of humor. the food there is pretty good too... LOVED the pulled pork!! Okay, now here's the bad news. The second night in the hotel my friends and I used the hotel hot tub. Two days later I woke up with the WORST allergic reaction I've ever had in my entire life all over my legs. We actually had to have a doctor come to the hotel to diagnose me, as I could barely walk. The doctor (employed by DisneyWorld) diagnosed the reaction as a reaction to potential hot tub bacteria that soaked into the pores in my legs. it's why the reaction stopped at my bathing suit line. when we informed the hotel, they were not receptive to the informaiton. they refused to take responsibility for it, which was very disappointing as we have been so impressed with Disney in the past. Fortunately, they did end up taking responsibility and covering all medical costs. However, my 10 day trip was essentially cut short - not only was it unbearably itchy, but it was so embarrassing to walk around with - people actually were commenting and asking me what was wrong (not Disney's fault). I was also unable to go out in the sun, as it would potentially irritate it. I ended up sleeping through the days and only going out at night. Other than this setback, we enjoyed our vacation thoroughly. We have been to DisneyWorld over 18 times and never expect less than the best. If you are a member of the vacation club, seriously consider this hotel. The location and transportation are also worth mentioning, as they were never an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: kmtruffe
Reviews.Content: my family of 5, consisting of myself, my wife, my 2 daughters (8 and 4) and son (2) stayed at the villas jan 28-feb 4. As background, my intention was to stay at the wilderness lodge but it was sold out, so i chose to stay in a studio at the wilderness lodge villas. We had an amazing vacation and here are the pros and cons of the villas: pros - beautiful grounds; handy and fun quiet pool that was uncrowded and had cool little "geysers"; very clean; very quiet (we rarely saw or heard anyone); lots of common areas in lobby area where you can play chess or checkers or simply sit on a big chair by a fireplace. cons - the studio wasn't worth the $65+ per night more than a standard wilderness lodge room. Sure, the microwave and toaster was nice, but not worth close to $500; the walk to get coffee in the morning took about 20 minutes and was very inconvenient. We stayed at the end of a very long hall, but I think it would be a pain in any room. A simple coffee stand/shop in the villas would have made a huge difference; after sending 2 faxes and a request at check-in asking for a "room with a water or pool view", our view ended up being of the back of the resort facing the linen storage area (we thought they were garbage bins at first); the maid service was a mid sporatic as we came "home" one day at 3:00 to an unserviced room which was a bit odd. Please don't think my "cons" suggest the place wasnt great. It was, but I would suggest getting a 1 or 2 bedroom villa instead of a studio so you get separate sitting areas, a full kitchen (studio just had a fridge, microwave, sink, and toaster).

Reviews.Title: “Warning!”
Reviews.Author: TravelsavyChicago
Reviews.Content: WARNING! Lots of Kids. Rooms appeared old and the property is under renoation. resort is not as nice as it looks online. Not worth the price for teh avrigation I experienced. On the plus side, it is very close to everything you want to do at Disney. Visit after the renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta Love the Outdoors!”
Reviews.Author: pmauldi
Reviews.Content: On a scale of 1-10, I would have to say that my recent stay at the Villas at Disney's Wilderness Lodge was a 9. I was somewhat disappointed that the Villas’ pool area was closed for refurbishment; therefore, I had to use the main pool at Wilderness Lodge which was not as convenient – or quiet, as the one just a few feet away. But overall, I did enjoy the rustic atmosphere of the resort as well as the scenic wooded areas.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing, but don't forget the "Do Not Disturb" sign.”
Reviews.Author: maddoxmoncrief
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Villas at Disney's Wilderness Lodge was wonderful. My room was very clean and the lodge itself was beautiful and relaxing. Disney has done a very good job of making you feel like you've traveled to the Pacific Northwest instead of central Florida. During my stay, I took advantage of in-room dining, full service dining at Whispering Canyon, recreation boat rentals, a massage at the spa and the swimming pools. Each time I visited these areas I encountered very friendly and knowledgeable staff. So if everything was great, why didn't I rate the resort as excellent? Well my trip lasted 4 days and 3 nights. Of those 3 nights I was woke up at 8:30 in the morning by someone from the Lodge knocking and attempting to enter my room. The first time, it was a Front Desk manager just stopping by to ask how my stay was going. That's great and all, but does this really need to happen at 8:30 am? Couldn't she have just called or slipped a note under the door? The last time I was woke up was again at 8:30. This time it was the housekeeping staff trying to get in and clean the room on the day I was to check out. Now checkout doesn't happen until 11:00 am, why on Earth are you trying to get into the room at 8:30? Because everything else during my stay was so great, I am willing to look past these two minor issues. I would recommend this resort to others and I would stay there again myself. Just don't forget to use the "Do Not Disturb" sign!

Reviews.Title: “Always wonderful, but some problems with the DVC”
Reviews.Author: MikkoN
Reviews.Content: We love the Villas at the Wilderness Lodge and we have stayed there several times. The rooms are spacious, well-appointed and QUIET! This is important after a full day. We stayed for a brief weekend this trip, so we didn't need the in-room washer and dryer, but it is a nice feature (they provide the Tide, but you should bring your own fabric softener). The pool for the Villas is lovely and much calmer than the pool at the Lodge. The fitness center is also large and full of good equipment. This was the first trip we took to Disney with our infant, and it is truly a baby friendly place. Besides the dishwasher and microwave (essentials) the pack 'n play was clean and just fine for our son. Service is always incredibly friendly. Only a few negative comments: My family belongs to the Disney Vacation Club. Member services was really lacking this time around when I called. I had difficulty getting assistance from the DVC person when I tried to set up the "Disney Magical Express" ride for us from the airport (I didn't have my member number on hand, and she simply said I was out of luck). When I tried talking to a DVC person in the flesh at one of their booths, they said they were helpless and couldn't do anything, and I should call member services. It was frustrating. The other slight negative, that we didn't notice before we had an infant is that it takes a LONG time to get to another hotel from the Lodge. We wanted to eat at the Polynesian and it took 45 minutes to get there by boat and monorail--there is no direct bus. In retrospect, we could have taken the bus to a park (which would stop at the Grand Floridian) and then taken the monorail. Plan accordingly with your little ones.

Reviews.Title: “Not so magical beginning”
Reviews.Author: huizarst
Reviews.Content: I recently visited WDW from May 29-June 5, 2007. This review covers my stay at the Wilderness Lodge Villas from May 29th thru June 3rd. You will have to read the extension of my review once we reached the Villas at Boardwalk Inn. Our trip began with a stay at the Wilderness Lodge Villas. We had visited the Lodge before to have dinner at the Whispering Canyon Restaurant and toured the grounds. To say we were impressed at what we saw and the excitement we felt as we checked in would be an understatement. We were checked in right away and placed in Room 3059. After a long day of travel getting to Florida, all we wanted to do was take a shower, rest for a bit and hit the parks that evening. When we first got to our room we found lights burned out on the bedside and the bathroom, and as we unpacked and started to stock our refrigerator I noticed there was a crack in the handle that subsequently pinched me at the tip of my finger. Not a good first impression. I told the front desk receptionist about our experience as we left for the park. When we returned, the lights had been fixed, but the fridge had not. Also as we settled in the night, I noticed a smell from behind the couch and so I pulled the couch out from the wall to find pepperoni left behind. To say it was disgusting would be in jest as my feelings to the overall attention to cleanliness and detail were far from positive. The next morning I got up to get a bottle of water from the fridge and again was pinched by the broken plastic handle. That was it and I felt I needed to communicate my disappointments with a manager. I went downstairs and spoke with a manger by the name of Alisha. She listened to all my concerns, apologized for the occurrences and assured me that the room would be cleaned again and fridge repaired to the best of her ability. I thanked her for her time and left for a day in the parks. When my family returned we were glad to see that the room had been cleaned, fridge replaced, but the complimentary fruit basket and note of apology was amazing. That bit of hospitality went a long way and helped put our trip on a magical course again. We stayed at the Lodge till June 3rd. Check out my continued saga on my review of the Villas at Boardwalk Inn. Magical just did not find my room there.

HotelInfo.Name: Villas at Disney's Wilderness Lodge
HotelInfo.Address: 901 Timberline Drive, Lake Buena Vista, Orlando, FL 32830
